load_embedding[source]

load_embedding(path)

dataloader for saved embeddings. Load from numpy file

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class BayesClusterTrainer[source]

BayesClusterTrainer(space, cost_fn_params, embeddings, labels, *args, **kwargs)

A trainer for cluster optimization runs Inputs: space: dict containing relevant parameter spaces for hdbscan and umap

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

BayesClusterTrainer.generate_clusters[source]

BayesClusterTrainer.generate_clusters(embeddings, min_cluster_size, cluster_selection_epsilon, cluster_selection_method, metric, n_neighbors, n_components, random_state=42)

Generate HDBSCAN cluster object after reducing embedding dimensionality with UMAP

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

BayesClusterTrainer.objective[source]

BayesClusterTrainer.objective(params, embeddings, labels)

Objective function for hyperopt to minimize, which incorporates constraints on the number of clusters we want to identify

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

BayesClusterTrainer.score_clusters[source]

BayesClusterTrainer.score_clusters(clusters, y, params)

Returns the label count and cost of a given cluster supplied from running hdbscan

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

BayesClusterTrainer.train[source]

BayesClusterTrainer.train(max_evals=100, algo=suggest)

Perform bayesian search on hyperopt hyperparameter space to minimize objective function

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

BayesClusterTrainer.save_logs_to_csv[source]

BayesClusterTrainer.save_logs_to_csv(path, dataset=None)

save logs to a csv file. Provide the path, optionally provide a dataset name. Creates new column.

{% endraw %}

Example:

{% raw %} 
label_list = [np.array([i]*250) for i in range(1,5)]
labels = np.hstack(label_list)

embedding_list = [np.random.randn(250, 768) + i for i in range(10,50,10)]
embeddings = np.vstack(embedding_list)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
labels.shape , embeddings.shape

((1000,), (1000, 768))
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
space = {
              'min_cluster_size':hp.choice('min_cluster_size', range(0, 1000)), 
              'cluster_selection_epsilon': hp.choice('cluster_selection_epsilon', np.linspace(0.05, 0.9, 100).tolist()),
              'cluster_selection_method' : hp.choice('cluster_selection_method',['eom','leaf']),
              'metric' : hp.choice('metric',['euclidean','manhattan']),
              'n_neighbors': hp.choice('n_neighbors', range(2, 100)),
              'n_components': hp.choice('n_components', range(2, 45))
        }


cost_fn_param = {'val_w': 0.15, 'prob_w': 0.25, 'pers_w': 0.2 , 'penalty_w': 0.25, 'outlier_w': 0.15}


trainer = BayesClusterTrainer(space, cost_fn_param, embeddings, labels)
trainer.train(max_evals=1)

#optional save logs to csv
# df = trainer.save_logs_to_csv('test.csv', dataset='news_20')
